title: Hard Stuck in high silver/ stuck with inters 30% of my games
body: Over this 4 day weekend I managed to get to my gold 5 promos for the first time :D, I lost my promos under the pressure really stuffed me up. Since I have had 6 games 3 wins 3 loses in those three loses 2 of those games I have had inters or people that don't know how to play their champ I don't have any idea of what I am meant to do to finally get out of this shit whole of a rank, it seems impossible. if anyone would like to help or has advice please share im sick of people ruining my games and not being able to get out of silver.

replies.body:
Solo Q is not about how good your team is, it is about how good you are. 

If you are in bronze 1 you can carry those games yea? cause you are way better than your oppent and can extend leads and end game off of it. Right now, it isnt about inters in your games, you are at a 50/50 win rate because your skills lv is arround that "you cant hard carry, and are more dependen on team play to win".

Just improve your game knowledge and you will climb out.

Its not that I cant hard carry its that my teammates wont let me carry, if u look at my match history about 80% of my games im positive doing everything that I can to win, I would about 60% of those games be able to carry if my team would let me, I play hyper carry champs and I would say im pretty good on them knowing how to play most of the matchups and what to build during them, yes I agree tho I do need to improve my game as there are things I can improve, at the moment im set to getting gold and then I will work harder on the things I need to thanks tho :)

Your recent KDA average is pretty low to consider "positive" at a 80% value (~1.88KDA).  Extending from what TheDemonEmperor stated, it is true that you cannot hard carry at your elo. He's not saying you can't carry ANY of your games, he saying you can't carry enough to climb out of your elo. This means that though you can gain an early lead (as you say), whether it be from winning your lane, or having a good few ganks, it means that out of a majority of games, you do not know how to extend that lead to victory, at least consistently.

Forget about other members of your team and solely focus on your own play, you don't want to let others tilt you. If you get inters just report at end screen and don't queue up for about 5-10minutes to minimise risk of getting them again.

Its different people every time and reporting them doesn't do anything I had some friend that made a second account he inted to lvl 30 and about 100 ranked games before he got banned, im done reporting people it doesn't do anything.

Hey OP! I started playing league about 1.75years ago and climbed from silver to diamond since then.

We all understand your struggle. If you are truly hard-carrying most of your games, you will naturally climb over a large sample of matches. Even a 55-60% winrate is a decent climb for a short period, so accept that you will never be able to hard-carry in all of your games (which is fine). If you do belong in gold, you'll get out of silver 100%. Intentional feeders exist on both your side and the enemy's. Over a long period of time, these games will even out unless you have a personality that "encourages" teammates to feed, like flaming. You probably just got unlucky if it happens a few times in a row. You will have games where people don't want to get carried but you'll have more where people do enough that you can.

If you want try try different styles to climb, try playing a champ where you can split push to nexus after winning your lane (or out-jungling the enemy). Most teams in silver solo q will not be able to communicate properly to react to your split pushing if done correctly. People do it to get to masters so you can easily do it to get out of silver if you take the time to learn.  

I looked you up on op.gg, try aiming for less deaths unless you're playing a split push champ (try for no more than 6).  It's good that you're playing hard-carry champs, but don't forget that you have to be highly consistent with those as you climb. 

Feel free to ask me anything. I'm more than willing to help and give you detailed answers/ideas.
